item.title: LP - Halo 3
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Grab the eraser tool, set the brush to a grunge, turn the opacity down on it, and erase the outer edges. Do it lightly all around the entire thing, don’t completely erase all of the edge, but just randomly erase it, all the way around, then do a once over going more detailed to make sure you coat the edge evenly. It’s grunge so it doesn’t have to be symmetrical, but it needs to look like it was scruffed up.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @brownsymcard brownsymcard
item.description:
@brownsymcard wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:28, topic:201886”][quote author=Unid H4x0r link=topic=266538.msg2203393#msg2203393 date=1209063851]

[/quote]

Why do you insist on making a border like that? Chuck it completely, it sucks.

You want people who merely have a generous mind and scoring system to actually lose their life, causing distress and confusion for the families and friends? Very christian like… how about rethinking what you just said?

Never judge another person like that. That is such a low thing to do.

Nothing posted here has been or will ever be a 10/10, because there is ALWAYS room to improve. Giving people false confidence is many times worse than shooting down their confidence. That being said, ratings are meaningless and egotistical. If you have any graphical knowledge, you would understand that ratings are subjective to the rater and to his personal tastes, and you would refrain from giving x/10. Just constructive criticism is enough.[/quote]

QFT

You my friend deserve an extra cookie for a good post. (Quite rare on these forums, as its population consists of 95% 10 year olds).

Just constructive criticism is enough.

item.title: LP - Halo 3
item.dc:creator: @brownsymcard brownsymcard
item.description:
@brownsymcard wrote:

[quote=“Unid H4x0r, post:17, topic:201886”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=266538.msg2203154#msg2203154 date=1209025127]
You just blurred the background, and the borders suck as much as ever.
[/quote]I left the original border, I guess I’ll make one.
Blurring is a technique for depth…[/quote]

When done properly. To make convincing depth with blurring you need to blur things differently at different focal length. There are also over sharpened parts in it where you can see the multi colored sharpen tool artifacts. The 2nd version also has quite of a bit of the layer mask brushing visible due to a layer style im assuming.

I would make a new border, and mess around with some of the lighting to add more depth, in place of blurring.

Read full topic
